page.title: 16Sizewell Power Station
page.content: There is a nuclear power station at Sizewell, called Sizewell A. It is situated on the Suffolk coast between Aldeburgh and Southwold. Leiston is the nearest town, with a population of 5,000. The power station occupies 245 acres.It is reached by road and there is a rail head at Sizewell halt. The station was opened on 1st.April 1967. The Central Electriaty Board is responsible for the operation of the power station.There are two platforms in the sea,one is near the shore and one is far away,for output and input of sea water used in cooling.A Nuclear Information centre and exhibition rooms can be visited by the public ,and guided tours of the power station are given.In 1984 the staff were as follows 346 Industrial,103 Engineers,33 administration.
